intro: Lippia jaliscana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lippia jaliscana is often used in traditional medicine and has potential applications in aromatherapy and herbal remedies.
